result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel W Cantrall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 50% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Comply with assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process
Maintain fulltime employment
Submit to DNA sample
Payment of all restitution, court obligations and supervision fees
No contact with Northshore Mobil Gas Station
No contact with Leslie Kesterson

Sentencing hearing on June 9, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Daniel W Cantrall #260271 by video from Stanley Correctional with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mcclendon advised court defendant is ready for change of plea/sentencing however a PSI is to be completed. Counsel files plea questionnaire, requesting adjournment for sentencing. State recommends: 15 years initial confinement, 10 years extended supervision.  Court examines defendant on plea questionnaire.  Defendant changes plea to no contest.  Court accepts change of plea & finds defendant guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
